content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, Write a function `clean_column` that cleans a column name (`col`) by lowercasing it, stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces, and replacing any spaces and hyphens with an underscore, eg, "My Column" becomes "my_column".

Sure, I can help you with that. Here's how you can define the `clean_column` function in Julia:

```julia
function clean_column(col::String)
    col = lowercase(col)  # lowercasing the string
    col = strip(col)  # removing leading and trailing whitespaces
    col = replace(col, " " => "_")  # replacing spaces with underscores
    col = replace(col, "-" => "_")  # replacing hyphens with underscores
    return col
end
```

This function takes a string as input (in this case, a column name), lowercases it, removes any leading or trailing whitespaces, and replaces any spaces and hyphens with an underscore. The cleaned column name is then returned by the function.
